did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: First Congregational Church of Canandaigua records, 1799-1978.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: First Congregational Church of Canandaigua (Canandaigua, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records of the Church including church meeting minutes (1799-1908), church discipline (1817-1881), church doctrine (1799-1844), meeting minutes (1805-1962), financial records (1805-1964), legal documents (1799-1939) and records of women's associations ((1824-1971).

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1799 a group of nine men and women banded together and with the help of missionary Zadoc Hunn organized the First Congregational Society of the Town of Canandaigua. They had no church building but held services in log houses, public buildings and various places. in 1812 with a membership of about forty communicants they erected a stately meeting house.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records of the Church including church meeting minutes (1799-1908), church discipline (1817-1881), church doctrine (1799-1844), meeting minutes (1805-1962), financial records (1805-1964), legal documents (1799-1939) and records of women's associations ((1824-1971).
